wikipedia_page.main: Ruaraidh Erskine of Marr (15 January 1869 – 5 January 1960) (Scottish Gaelic: Ruaraidh Arascain is Mhàirr) was a Scottish nationalist political activist, writer and Scottish Gaelic language campaigner.

response: By the time of the formation of the NPS, the Scots National League had outgrown its London roots and become stronger in Scotland, largely due to the influence of Tom Gibson.  Gibson had realised that nationalist politics needed to be connected to everyday issues in order to become popular.  This strain of thought was prominent within the NPS and many former Scots National League members drifted from it due to their belief that the NPS was too moderate.  This included Ruairidh Erskine himself, who drifted entirely from politics.
